nodes.bodyText:
The changes in this class are problematic, as they are publicly documented API. Changing these could break a user's application.
https://www.ibm.com/support/knowledgecenter/SSYKE2_8.0.0/com.ibm.java.api.80.doc/com.ibm.lang.management/com/ibm/lang/management/MemoryMXBean.html
I think all we can do here is add the alternatives in addition to the original API, and deprecate the original for later removal.

We'll also have to generate new docs.
The OpenJ9 version of the docs
https://www.eclipse.org/openj9/docs/api-langmgmt/
https://www.eclipse.org/openj9/docs/api/jdk8/jre/management/extension/com/ibm/lang/management/MemoryMXBean.html
I have added back and deprecated the master/slave public methods and created a docs issue: eclipse-openj9/openj9-docs#607

Pls use the long form for Java 11+, i.e. @Deprecated(forRemoval=true, since="15").
You can create the processor instructions for Java 16 and remove the methods for Java 16+.
I have updated the deprecated annotation and added preprocessor instructions to remove the methods in Java16.
I don't think this works for Java 8 (Java 8 won't compile), you need to use the processor.
